message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.DL, cs.SI, cs.CY. 

The paper describes a system for visual exploration of research papers using natural language processing techniques to extract terms and create maps of computer science based on word and phrase similarity. The system also allows for the visualization of conference or journal profiles and the evolution of research topics over time. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category, as it deals with techniques for organizing and visualizing large amounts of information. Additionally, the use of natural language processing techniques suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) and Deep Learning (cs.DL) sub-categories. The visualization aspect of the system may also make it relevant to the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) and Cybersecurity (cs.CY) sub-categories.
